translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The forward and reverse order of conditions, the Tipitaka, the Paṭṭhāna text
The wholesome triad, the defiled triad

original: Akusalaṁ saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nasaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Abyākataṁ asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā naabyākato naasaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Abyākataṁ asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā🔽nakusalo naasaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Abyākataṁ asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ
analyzed: akusalam saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  abyākatam a saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikam dhammam paccayā na abyākataḥ na a saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā abyākatam asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikam dhammam paccayā  na kusalaḥ na asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā abyākatam asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesika
translated: With an unwholesome, defiled, and defiling state as condition, there arises a non-unwholesome, non-defiled, and non-defiling state, as a root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.) In the case of root-cause, there are three; in the case of predominance, there are three; … in the case of non-hindrance, there are three.🔽With an indeterminate, undefiled, and non-defiling state as condition, there arises an indeterminate, undefiled, and non-defiling state, as a root-cause condition. With an indeterminate, undefiled, and non-defiling state as condition, there arises

original: dhammaṁ paccayā naakusalo naasaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: dhammam paccayā na akusalaḥ na asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: a wholesome, undefiled, and non-defiling state, as a root-cause condition. With an indeterminate, undefiled, and non-defiling state as condition, there arises🔽a unwholesome, undefiled, and non-defiling state, as a root-cause condition.

original: Abyākataṁ asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nakusalo naasaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko🔽ca naabyākato naasaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. Abyākataṁ
analyzed: abyākatam asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikam dhammam paccayā na kusalaḥ na asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesiko  ca na abyākataḥ na asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesiko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā abyākata

original: asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā naakusalo naasaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko ca naabyākato🔽naasaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. Abyākataṁ asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ
analyzed: a saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikam dhammam paccayā na akusalaḥ na a saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesiko ca na abyākataḥ  na asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesiko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā abyākatam asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesika
translated: With an unwholesome, not-corrupted-but-subject-to-corruption, …🔽With an unwholesome, not-corrupted-but-subject-to-corruption, …

original: dhammaṁ paccayā nakusalo naasaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko ca naakusalo naasaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko🔽ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, ārammaṇe cha …pe… āsevane🔽pañca …pe… vipāke tīṇi, avigate cha.
analyzed: dhammam paccayā na kusalaḥ na a saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesiko ca na akusalaḥ na a saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesiko  ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha ārammaṇe cha pe āsevane  pañca pe vipāke tīṇi avigate cha

original: Kusalaṁ asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naasaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: kusalam asaṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na asaṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: (In brief.) As to root cause, six; as to object, six; as to prenascence, six; as to proximity, six; as to contiguity, six; as to dissociation, six; as to presence, six; as to non-disappearance, six; as to kamma result, three; as to nutriment, five; as to faculty, five; as to jhāna, five; as to path, five; as to association, six; as to non-dissociation, six; as to presence, six; as to absence, six; as to disappearance, six; as to prerequisite, six; as to condition, six; as to non-deprivation, six.🔽With a wholesome, not-corrupted-but-subject-to-corruption, …🔽With a wholesome, not-corrupted-but-subject-to-corruption, …

original: Abyākataṁ asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naasaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: abyākatam asaṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na asaṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With an unwholesome root cause as condition, a wholesome root cause arises … (Abbreviated.)🔽With an unwholesome root cause as condition, a neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome root cause arises … (Abbreviated.)🔽With an unwholesome root cause as condition, a wholesome root cause arises … (Abbreviated.)🔽With an unwholesome root cause as condition, an unwholesome thought … an unwholesome view … an unwholesome attainment … an unwholesome wholesome attainment … an unwholesome neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome attainment arises … (Abbreviated.)🔽With an unwholesome root cause as condition, an unwholesome thought … an unwholesome view … an unwholesome attainment … an unwholesome wholesome attainment … an unwholesome neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome attainment arises … (Abbreviated.)🔽With an unwholesome root cause as condition, an unwholesome thought … an unwholesome view … an unwholesome attainment … an unwholesome wholesome attainment … an unwholesome neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome attainment arises … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: hetuyā cha adhipatiyā cha pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate cha
